intro: Cenocline cinerea, commonly known as the gray cenocline, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its grayish-green foliage and small, daisy-like flowers that bloom in the summer months. Native to the western United States, it thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and full sun exposure. The plant has a compact growth habit and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and sagebrush steppe. Its botanical features make it an important component of local ecosystems and a subject of study in plant ecology.
